name: Islamic Foundation of Nevada
mission: TO PROVICDE A HIGH QUALITY OF EDUCATION TO ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL CHILDREN AND TO PROVIDE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY A BURIAL PLACE TO PRACTICE TRADIT...
theoryOfChange: By investing in educational access (scholarships) and leadership development (Cotillion/mentoring), the foundation aims to create a lasting impact for generations and build a more equitable community.

score_details.score_summary: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada earns 51/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The mission and programs of Islamic Foundation of Nevada, as described in available information, focus on providing elementary and secondary education and a burial place for the local community. There is no explicit mention of accepting zakat donations on their website or in their organizational descriptions.

strengths.detail: The organization operates with remarkable efficiency, spending <cite id="1">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
IFN maintains <cite id="1">31.4 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, ensuring long-term institutional sustainability.
The foundation successfully balances <cite id="2">$1,665,328 in contributions</cite> with <cite id="2">$1,565,776 in program service revenue</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada demonstrates a high degree of financial stability, evidenced by its <cite id="2">$6,265,666 in total assets</cite> against minimal <cite id="2">liabilities of $169,724</cite>. This fiscal health allows the organization to dedicate a <cite id="1">75.5% program expense ratio</cite> toward its core mission of education and community services. Furthermore, the foundation's ability to award <cite id="4">$265,000 in total financial support</cite> through its scholarship programs highlights its role as a critical pillar for local academic advancement.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada (IFN) is an established community institution that has been <cite id="1">operating since 2001</cite> to serve the educational and spiritual needs of the local Muslim community. The organization reported <cite id="2">$3,248,200 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, reflecting a significant <cite id="2">31.7% three-year revenue CAGR</cite>. IFN's primary mission focuses on providing <cite id="2">high-quality elementary and secondary education</cite> while maintaining essential community infrastructure, including burial services. Beyond its core educational mandate, the foundation manages a diverse portfolio of leadership and scholarship initiatives, such as the <cite id="4">Cotillion Leadership Program</cite> and the <cite id="4">Cooley-Moore Scholarship Luncheon</cite>. These programs are designed to foster youth development and academic excellence. Financially, the organization maintains <cite id="1">31.4 months of working capital</cite>, indicating an exceptionally strong liquidity position that functions as a long-term endowment for the community's future stability.
